Maybe

> Originally the Luminator (bioluminator) was designed to equal out a 
> persons work environment, for health reasons. It was then found by 
> the inventor (Patrick Richards) that he was able to photograph 
> individuals (with the machine working) to determine their health 
> condition, in a weird sort of way.  The blurrier the photo, the 
more 
> unhealthy the person photographed was said to be. (I don't think 
> there was ever a mention of spirits being seen.)
> He would try to match medication with a patient based on a blurry 
or 
> focused print.
> After reading a bit about how Macy may use it, it does sound like 
low 
> light conditions are used and preferred, and this may be why the 
> double or triple exposure condition is seen on the film.
> 
> I'm not trying to discount what he (Macy) is doing, just sharing 
what 
> I've researched.
> 
> - Mike
